abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, and, despite delays in the legislative
            process, the Borrower fully complied with the conditions of
            the loan. While sustainability is likely, it is however
            subject to a number of risks, namely, the need for further
            reforms, and, a new course remains to be charted for a
            viable retirement security system, that encourages private
            savings. The key lessons convey that: 1) the analytical
            tools applied, allowed the Borrower to conduct its own
            analysis, and, staff trained in the use of simulation
            models, both quantified liabilities, and determined optimal
            reform strategies. This approach is considered critical in
            mobilizing essential resource support for future amendments
            to the Constitution, and further structural reforms; 2) the
            politics of social security reform should be considered
            early, to prod a fruitful dialogue, as in this case, the
            support to provide only modest improvements to the reformed
            pension system, as requested by the Government, allowed
            greater influence on the formulation of future reforms; 3)
            comprehensive public awareness is critical for successful
            social insurance, and pension reforms, though information on
            fiscal imbalances of pension systems alone, is not enough,
            for, inevitably it will hinder the Administration's
            reform strategy; and, 4) the selection of a single-tranche
            adjustment instrument, was appropriate, given the
            politically sensitive policy agenda.
